lu.uni.distributedsystems.project.gambler

Class GamblerServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • lu.uni.distributedsystems.project.common.RemoteControllableServer
      • lu.uni.distributedsystems.project.gambler.GamblerServer

  • public class GamblerServer
extends RemoteControllableServer
    JSON-RPC server associated with a gambler. Receives JSON-RPC methods via a socket connection. All methods that should be exposed to remote JSON-RPC calls must be defined in this class. Use the @RMI annotation for all such JSON-RPC methods.
    Author:
    steffen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GamblerServer(Gambler gambler, java.lang.String gamblerIP, int gamblerPort, CommandProcessor commandProcessor)
      Create a new JSON-RPC server instance that is associated with a gambler.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GamblerServer

        public GamblerServer(Gambler gambler,
                     java.lang.String gamblerIP,
                     int gamblerPort,
                     CommandProcessor commandProcessor)
        Create a new JSON-RPC server instance that is associated with a gambler.
        Parameters:
        gambler - enclosing gambler this JSON-RPC server is associated with
        gamblerIP - IP address the JSON-RPC server shall listen on
        gamblerPort - port number the JSON-RPC server shall listen on
        commandProcessor - command processor used for processing remote commands

    • Method Detail

      • getGamblerIP

        public java.lang.String getGamblerIP()
        Gets the IP address this JSON-RPC server listens on.
        Returns:
        IP address of this JSON-RPC server listens on

      • getGamblerPort

        public int getGamblerPort()
        Gets the port number this JSON-RPC server listens on.
        Returns:
        The port number this JSON-RPC server listens on

      • sayHelloToGambler

        public java.lang.String sayHelloToGambler(java.lang.String bookieName)
        Simple hello method for testing and reference purposes.

        Please note that the @RMI annotation exposes a method for remote invocation

        Parameters:
        bookieName - name of the bookie who says hello
        Returns:
        Hello reply message sent back to the remote bookie

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the JSON-RPC server. All methods tagged with the @RMI annotation will be invokable remotely. All requests as well as all responses will be passed on to the Interceptor instantiated in the body of this method.
